verses.kjv: And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.
verses.web: David counted the people who were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.
verses.ct: David organized the troops who were with him, appointing commanders over groups of 1,000 and commanders over groups of 100.

verses.kjv: And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.
verses.web: David sent the people out, a third part under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. The king said to the people, “I will also surely go out with you myself.”
verses.ct: He then divided the army into 3 divisions: one third under Joab's command, one third under Joab's brother Abishai son of Zeruiah, and one third under Ittai the Gittite. The king told the troops, "I'm going to march out with you myself."

verses.kjv: But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou succour us out of the city.
verses.web: But the people said, “You shall not go out; for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us. But you are worth ten thousand of us. Therefore now it is better that you are ready to help us out of the city.”
verses.ct: But the troops objected. "You must not come with us," they said. "If we have to retreat, the enemy won't care about us. Even if half of us die, they won't care. But you are worth 10,000 of us. It's better for you to stay in the city and send us reinforcements if we need them."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.
verses.web: The king said to them, “I will do what seems best to you.” The king stood beside the gate, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.
verses.ct: The king replied, "I'll do whatever you think is best." So he stood beside the gate as all the troops marched out in units of hundreds and thousands.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
verses.web: The king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, “Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom.” All the people heard when the king commanded all the captains concerning Absalom.
verses.ct: Then the king gave an order to Joab, Abishai, and Ittai: "For my sake, be gentle with the young man Absalom." Every soldier heard the king give this command to all the commanders about Absalom.

verses.kjv: So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;
verses.web: So the people went out into the field against Israel; and the battle was in the forest of Ephraim.
verses.ct: The army marched out into the open country to fight against Israel, and the battle took place in the forest of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand men.
verses.web: The people of Israel were struck there before David’s servants, and there was a great slaughter there that day of twenty thousand men.
verses.ct: David's forces crushed the army of Israel there, and the slaughter that day was enormous — 20,000 men fell.

verses.kjv: For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
verses.web: For the battle was there spread over the surface of all the country, and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
verses.ct: The fighting spread across the entire countryside, and the dense forest claimed more lives that day than the sword did.

verses.kjv: And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.
verses.web: Absalom happened to meet David’s servants. Absalom was riding on his mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the sky and earth; and the mule that was under him went on.
verses.ct: Absalom suddenly ran into a group of David's soldiers. He was riding his mule, and as the mule passed under the thick branches of a massive oak tree, Absalom's head got caught in the branches. He was left dangling between heaven and earth as the mule kept going without him.

verses.kjv: And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.
verses.web: A certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, “Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak.”
verses.ct: One of the soldiers saw this and reported it to Joab: "I just saw Absalom hanging from an oak tree!"

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.
verses.web: Joab said to the man who told him, “Behold, you saw it, and why didn’t you strike him there to the ground? I would have given you ten pieces of silver, and a sash.”
verses.ct: Joab snapped at the man, "You saw him? Why didn't you strike him down right there? I would have given you 10 shekels of silver and a belt!"

verses.kjv: And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in mine hand, yet would I not put forth mine hand against the king’s son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.
verses.web: The man said to Joab, “Though I should receive a thousand pieces of silver in my hand, I still wouldn’t stretch out my hand against the king’s son; for in our hearing the king commanded you and Abishai and Ittai, saying, ‘Beware that no one touch the young man Absalom.’
verses.ct: But the man replied, "Even if you put 1,000 shekels of silver in my hand, I wouldn't lay a finger on the king's son. We all heard the king command you, Abishai, and Ittai: 'Make sure no one harms the young man Absalom.'

verses.kjv: Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.
verses.web: Otherwise if I had dealt falsely against his life (and there is no matter hidden from the king), then you yourself would have set yourself against me.”
verses.ct: If I had killed him and risked my own life doing it — since nothing stays hidden from the king — you yourself would have turned against me."

verses.kjv: Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
verses.web: Then Joab said, “I’m not going to wait like this with you.” He took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the middle of the oak.
verses.ct: Joab said, "I'm not going to waste any more time with you." He grabbed 3 spears and drove them into Absalom's heart while Absalom was still alive, hanging in the oak tree.

verses.kjv: And ten young men that bare Joab’s armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
verses.web: Ten young men who bore Joab’s armor surrounded and struck Absalom, and killed him.
verses.ct: Then 10 of Joab's armor-bearers surrounded Absalom, struck him, and finished him off.

verses.kjv: And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.
verses.web: Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel; for Joab held the people back.
verses.ct: Joab sounded the trumpet, and the troops stopped chasing the Israelites, because Joab called them back.

verses.kjv: And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
verses.web: They took Absalom and cast him into a great pit in the forest, and raised over him a very great heap of stones. Then all Israel fled, each to his own tent.
verses.ct: They took Absalom's body, threw it into a deep pit in the forest, and piled a huge mound of stones over it. Meanwhile, every Israelite soldier fled to his own home.

verses.kjv: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which is in the king’s dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom’s place.
verses.web: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself the pillar which is in the king’s valley, for he said, “I have no son to keep my name in memory.” He called the pillar after his own name. It is called Absalom’s monument, to this day.
verses.ct: During his lifetime, Absalom had set up a stone pillar for himself in the King's Valley, because he said, "I have no son to carry on my name." He named the pillar after himself, and to this day it's still called Absalom's Monument.

verses.kjv: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the LORD hath avenged him of his enemies.
verses.web: Then Ahimaaz the son of Zadok said, “Let me now run and carry the king news, how LORD has avenged him of his enemies.”
verses.ct: Ahimaaz son of Zadok said, "Let me run and bring the king the news that the LORD has delivered him from his enemies!"

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king’s son is dead.
verses.web: Joab said to him, “You must not be the bearer of news today, but you must carry news another day. But today you must carry no news, because the king’s son is dead.”
verses.ct: But Joab told him, "You're not the one to carry the news today. You can carry news some other time, but not today — the king's son is dead."

verses.kjv: Then said Joab to Cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.
verses.web: Then Joab said to the Cushite, “Go, tell the king what you have seen!” The Cushite bowed himself to Joab, and ran.
verses.ct: Then Joab turned to a Cushite messenger and said, "Go tell the king what you've seen." The Cushite bowed to Joab and took off running.

verses.kjv: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after Cushi. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready?
verses.web: Then Ahimaaz the son of Zadok said yet again to Joab, “But come what may, please let me also run after the Cushite.” Joab said, “Why do you want to run, my son, since you will have no reward for the news?”
verses.ct: But Ahimaaz pressed Joab again: "No matter what happens, please let me run after the Cushite." Joab said, "Why do you want to run, my son? You don't even have any real news to deliver."

verses.kjv: But howsoever, said he, let me run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran Cushi.
verses.web: “But come what may,” he said, “I will run.” He said to him, “Run!” Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the Plain, and outran the Cushite.
verses.ct: "I don't care," Ahimaaz said. "Let me run." So Joab told him, "Then run!" Ahimaaz took the route through the Jordan plain and outran the Cushite.

verses.kjv: And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.
verses.web: Now David was sitting between the two gates; and the watchman went up to the roof of the gate to the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, a man running alone.
verses.ct: David was sitting between the inner and outer gates of the city. The watchman had climbed to the roof above the gate, up on the wall. He looked up and saw a man running alone.

verses.kjv: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.
verses.web: The watchman cried, and told the king. The king said, “If he is alone, there is news in his mouth.” He came closer and closer.
verses.ct: The watchman called down and told the king. David said, "If he's alone, he's bringing news." The runner kept getting closer.

verses.kjv: And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.
verses.web: The watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called to the gatekeeper, and said, “Behold, a man running alone!” The king said, “He also brings news.”
verses.ct: Then the watchman spotted a second man running. He called down to the gatekeeper, "There's another man running alone!" The king said, "He must be bringing news too."

verses.kjv: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.
verses.web: The watchman said, “I think the running of the first one is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok.” The king said, “He is a good man, and comes with good news.”
verses.ct: The watchman said, "The first runner looks like Ahimaaz son of Zadok, based on the way he runs." The king said, "He's a good man — he must be coming with good news."

verses.kjv: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the LORD thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.
verses.web: Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, “All is well.” He bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, “Blessed is LORD your God, who has delivered up the men who lifted up their hand against my lord the king!”
verses.ct: Ahimaaz called out as he approached, "All is well!" He bowed facedown before the king and said, "Praise the LORD your God! He has handed over the men who raised their hands against my lord the king!"

verses.kjv: And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king’s servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.
verses.web: The king said, “Is it well with the young man Absalom?” Ahimaaz answered, “When Joab sent the king’s servant, even me your servant, I saw a great tumult, but I don’t know what it was.”
verses.ct: The king asked, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" Ahimaaz answered, "When Joab sent me, I saw some kind of big commotion, but I don't know what it was about."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.
verses.web: The king said, “Come and stand here.” He came, and stood still.
verses.ct: The king said, "Step aside and wait here." So Ahimaaz moved aside and stood there.

verses.kjv: And, behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the LORD hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.
verses.web: Behold, the Cushite came. The Cushite said, “News for my lord the king, for LORD has avenged you today of all those who rose up against you.”
verses.ct: Then the Cushite arrived and said, "I have news for my lord the king! The LORD has delivered you today from everyone who rebelled against you!"

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
verses.web: The king said to the Cushite, “Is it well with the young man Absalom?” The Cushite answered, “May the enemies of my lord the king, and all who rise up against you to do you harm, be as that young man is.”
verses.ct: The king asked the Cushite, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" The Cushite answered, "May all the enemies of my lord the king — and everyone who rises up to harm you — end up like that young man."

verses.kjv: And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
verses.web: The king was much moved, and went up to the room over the gate, and wept. As he went, he said, “My son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! I wish I had died for you, Absalom, my son, my son!”
verses.ct: The king was shattered. He went up to the room above the gate and wept. As he walked, he cried out, "O my son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you — O Absalom, my son, my son!"
